position: Summer 2021 Internship in Software Engineering - Machine Learning
description:
Summer Internship - Software Engineering - Machine Learning focus

US Citizenship is required due to US Government security clearance rules.

Summer interns in Software Engineering at Expedition Technology will work closely with experienced engineers to develop software products within an R&D environment and write code to develop machine learning applications running novel algorithms in cloud-based environments.

Interns will utilize software engineering best practices such as code reviews and unit testing to develop in a cloud computing paradigm. Additionally, interns will also leverage cloud computing providers such as AWS to accelerate development and training of deep learning models.

There be opportunity to provide specific input into the software components of the system design, to include hardware/software trade offs, software reuse, as well as requirements analysis and synthesis from system level to individual software components.

Here is what one of our interns did during the summer of 2019: https://www.exptechinc.com/machine-learning/my-summer-at-expedition-technology-as-a-machine-learning-intern/

Read this to see what one of our mentors had to say about internships at EXP: https://www.exptechinc.com/news/the-exp-internship-program/

Qualifications

A successful intern candidate should have the following qualifications:

Some experience with front-end and backend software development within a Linux-based environment (school-based projects and classroom experience are acceptable)
Some experience with Docker and Git
Knowledge of any or all of the following languages: Python, C++, Java, Javascript (Python strongly preferred)
Current student pursuing a Bachelor’s degree or Master's degree in computer science, computer engineering or a related discipline
Self-starter attitude and willingness to work on problems that don't always have a clearly-defined solution
Undergraduate or graduate students graduating in December 2021 and/or May 2022 will be given preference
Must be a US Citizen

Expedition Technology is an employee-owned defense and aerospace technology small business that has become a market leader in developing software applications running advanced machine learning algorithms for the DOD and Intelligence Communities. We offer a collaborative team-based culture, a people-first mentality and a focus on cutting edge solutions.

EXP is proud that our dynamic and collaborative culture along with our generous benefits package allowed us to earn a spot on the 2019 and the 2020 Washington Business Journal's Best Places to Work List.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer that believes a diverse range of talent creates an environment that fuels creativity and innovation. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, national origin, genetic information or protected veteran status.

position: Summer 2021 Internship in Machine Learning, Signal Processing and Computer Vision
description:
Summer Internship in Machine Learning, Signal Processing and Computer Vision

Please note: US Citizenship is a requirement for these positions due to US Government rules regarding security clearances.

At Expedition Technology (EXP), we push the boundaries of what is possible every day. Our engineers work on the toughest problems in Computer Vision, Image Processing and Digital Signal Processing using applied deep learning and machine learning to solve the most complicated computer vision, signal processing and image processing problems for our customers. Each success we have furthers our vision of building EXP into a formidable provider of differentiated products and solutions for our Department of Defense and Intelligence Community clients.

Our standards are high and the opportunities are amazing. You’ll have the chance to work with the best and brightest minds in engineering, physics, math and more while leading ground-breaking work that will help our country maintain security and operational advantage in a constantly changing world.

We Are Especially Interested In Candidates With An Interest In One Or More Of The Following Areas

We are seeking interns for the summer of 2020 to support our projects and learn applied machine learning and signal processing techniques.

Machine-learning, including deep-learning
Computer vision and pattern recognition
Image and video processing
Digital signal processing
Data science and analysis
Navigation and tracking

Successful applicants will work closely with senior engineers to support one of our programs, potentially including a combination of conceptual R&D and product development. Interns will be compensated at an hourly rate of pay.

Find out what summer at EXP is like by reading this blog post written by one our amazing former interns: https://www.exptechinc.com/machine-learning/my-summer-at-expedition-technology-as-a-machine-learning-intern/

Requirements For Summer Internships

Must be currently attending college or university pursuing undergraduate or graduate degree in engineering, computer science, computer engineering, physics, math or related field of study
Some experience with programming in Python (Python strongly preferred, Matlab acceptable)
Proven interest in machine learning/deep learning, signal processing or computer vision through course selection, extra-curricular club activities and/or personal reading or projects
Students with graduation dates of December, 2021 or May, 2022 (rising seniors and/or second-year grad students) very strongly preferred
U.S. citizenship is required

Also, read the perspective of one of our intern mentors as she reflects upon our summer 2019 intern program: https://www.exptechinc.com/news/the-exp-internship-program/

EXP is an employee-owned defense and aerospace technology company seeking scientists and engineers who enjoy tackling challenging problems. Our standards are high and the opportunities are amazing. You’ll have the chance to work with the best and brightest minds in engineering, physics, math and more while leading ground-breaking work that will help our country maintain a security and operational advantage in a constantly changing world.

EXP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer that believes a diverse range of talent creates an environment that fuels creativity and innovation. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, national origin, genetic information or protected veteran status.

simplehuman has an internship role for someone who is studying or recently graduated from the field of Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Computer Science. The intern will support the development of small footprint consumer electronic products. Responsibilities include designing and implementing tests before product launches. This may involve testing both hardware and software application functionality, the building of automated test fixtures, and debugging and defining corrective actions. Products will range from new product introductions as well as existing product improvements.

This is an ideal role for someone interested in gaining some experience in consumer electronic product development. This role can potentially turn into a full-time position. Working hours are 20-40 hours per week, with a minimum 3 month commitment.

Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To

Perform manual and automated testing
Identify, isolate and track bugs throughout testing
Create test plan and document test cases
Identify any potential problems that users might encounter
Review user interfaces for consistency and functionality


Skills & Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or student in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or Computer Science
Familiarity with electronics circuit and black box testing related to safety and performance
Experience with LabView is a plus
Previous consumer product and application testing experience is a plus
Strong attention to detail and organization
Ability to work as part of a team


SDL2019-32

2021 Summer Intern – Systems Engineering

One global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place.

Raytheon Technologies (RTX) offers an innovative and inclusive culture; welcoming diversity and collaboration and providing numerous opportunities for career growth.

The System Design & Architecture Directorate is the central focus for Mission Systems Integration activities within Raytheon Missiles & Defense (RMD). The more than 2,100 employees provide requirements definition and design at the system, subsystem and component level every day in a collaborative environment characterized by respect for the individual, problem solving in a team setting, consensus oriented solutions, and results based recognition. Supporting this mission are teams providing domain expertise and creative solutions in surveillance, naval and missile defense based radar system design, undersea sensor system design, integrated air and missile defense systems engineering, command and control/battle management system design, combat system and platform architecture design and integration, software intensive system engineering, cyber solutions and algorithm development for signal processing, tracking and discrimination systems. The team welcomes you to join our tradition of excellence through innovation and teamwork while championing individual diversity in a flexible work environment to meet the needs of today’s workforce.

Join this highly visible team and perform technically challenging assignments that will directly contribute to protecting our nation and our war fighters.

Job Description

Our Systems Engineers use engineering and math skills to define the architecture of the system (the “pieces” and how they interact), the performance and functional requirements of the system (what the system must be capable of doing and how well), the subsystem design and requirements (what components are needed and how they must perform), and the integration of the components into the overall system.

Specific job responsibilities will likely include search/track/discrimination algorithm development, performance assessment trade studies, and analysis of sensor signal and data processing. Systems Engineers use MATLAB regularly to conduct data analyses. Candidates should be comfortable working independently and in a team environment.

Required Skills
Candidates must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program with an emphasis in Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace, Computer Science or Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Physics or related technical field.
This position requires the eligibility to obtain a security clearance. Except in rare circumstances, only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance.
Desired Skills:
Leadership or participation in college campus organizations, athletics teams, or community service groups
Strong analytical skills
Minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA
Relevant work or project experience in algorithm design, requirements development, software/hardware integration and configuration management
Familiarity with Microsoft Office toolset
MATLAB experience
Programming experience in modern computer programming languages (JAVA, C++, C)
Engineering project, internship or co-op experience
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Educational background or interest in the following areas:
Radar Architecture and or algorithms
Signal Processing and Control theory
Model based engineering and architecture
Statistics, random processes and detection methods
Imaging / pattern recognition
Data filtering and processing techniques (e.g. Kalman, batch, optimal)
Ability to pursue information (“self-starter”)
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment
Authored Technical Papers and / or Technical Presentations
At RTX, we innovate to create solutions and solve complex challenges across all domains: from land and sea to air, space, and cyberspace. In doing so, we embrace the talent, expertise and perspectives of our diverse workforce, each bringing their skills, ideas and dedication to the work we do. We pride ourselves on our commitment to our customers, industry partners and our teammates, making a positive impact not only to our business, but also in our communities where we live and work. Our constant innovation is made possible by a strong culture, investing in our people, and an unwavering vision that is shared by RTX employees across the globe – a vision of one global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place.

RTX has been recognized as a respected employer and valued corporate citizen for our employment practices, programs and community support by a number of highly-regarded organizations. The list includes: Forbes, Glassdoor, National Veterans Small Business Association, Corporate Responsibility Magazine, Environmental Protection Agency, Affinity Inc. and many more.

What We Offer: Whether you are just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, RTX offers a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the superior benefits RTX offers include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care.

All these job responsibilities are to be executed in harmony with Raytheon Technologies' Code of Business Ethics and Conduct policy which sets the standard by which we operate and how we treat others.

Raytheon Technologies is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or Vietnam era, or other eligible veteran status, or any other protected factor. 165296

Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

position: 2021 Key Technology, Operations and Services Internship - Buffalo
description:
Job Description

Buffalo Internship

About The Business

Key Technology, Operations & Services (KTOS) brings the future of banking to life. KeyBank is equal parts financial institution and technology innovator, and the KTOS team is at the center of creating solutions to solve the vital needs of our clients first.

KTOS – made up of more than 5,000 talented teammates – enables the technology needs of business partners and clients across the enterprise. Through efficient, reliable, and secure technology, KTOS delivers a competitive distinction through innovation and collaboration.

KTOS Is Accountable For a Variety Of Critical Functions That Are The Foundation For Key’s Day-to-day Operations

KTOS plays a significant role in Key’s ability to build enduring client relationships through innovative solutions & extraordinary service.

Business Delivery, providing comprehensive technology solutions to Key’s lines of business & functional areas
Enterprise Technology including architecture, networks and data centers to ensure stable systems and platforms
Enterprise Data and Information Management, enabling transformation of customer and market data into valuable insights and analytics
Enterprise Operations, spanning Origination through Default Management (1.1 million loans worth $82 billion); Deposit Operations (5 million client accounts); ACH, Wire & Check Payment Operations ($400 billion monthly), Treasury Operations
Enterprise Procurement, managing $1.3+ billion in annual spend and Key’s Third-Party Management program
Enterprise Security, including Tech Risk Management, Information Security, Cybersecurity, Fraud Detection/Management, BSA/AML Operations and Physical Security

About the Position (location: Buffalo, NY)
Our summer internship program spans 10 weeks in duration and allows you to work alongside KeyBank’s experts within Key Technology, Operations & Services (KTOS). The internship provides an opportunity to get hands-on experience with our innovative operations and technology teams. Our internships will equip you with competitive skills, valuable networking and mentoring and exposure to executives through a structured experience.

Opportunities where interns may be placed include one of 2 tracks:
Technology Track: KTOS Technology teams deliver innovative technology & solutions based on client need as well as build, design and improve upon systems and processes in multiple lines of business.

Opportunities For Intern Placement

Robotic Process Automation & Digitization
Architecture/Data Engineering
Network Infrastructure
Software Coding and Engineering
DevOps

Operations Track: KTOS Operations teams deliver world-class operations solutions and continual process improvements while supporting multiple lines of business.

Opportunities For Intern Placement

Reporting and Analytics
Payment Processing Operations
Business Risk and Controls
Corporate Procurement
Workforce Management
Continuous Improvement


Our Internship Program Offers

Work alongside industry experts and professionals on critical projects
Exposure to KeyBank and Key Technology, Operations & Services
Training and learning opportunities:

On-the-job training, Excel and PowerPoint, Office 365, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, VBA
Enhancing soft skills, problem resolution and critical thinking
Opportunities to use industry leading software (examples include: Tableau, ServiceNow, Visual Studio, Jira, Automation Anywhere, Jenkins, PowerShell, HTML, C#, Python, SQL, JavaScript)
Community involvement
Networking opportunities
Engagement with senior leaders
Upon successful completion of the internship, you will have the opportunity to be considered for placement (after graduation) in our KTOS Rotational Analyst Program. Candidacy for the program will be based on skills demonstrated, performance, career interests, internship experience and business demand.


The Ideal Candidate Should

Be enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program in Computer Science, Information Systems, IT Management, Software Engineering, Web Development, Computer Programming, Network Engineering, Game Design and System Administration or related field or Industrial Engineering, Operations, Statistics/ Mathematics, Business or related field
Have a proven academic record with a preferred minimum GPA of 3.3
Demonstrate the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team
Be actively involved in community and/or extracurricular activities
Bring solid analytical, problem solving, communication and presentation skills
Possess intellectual curiosity, enthusiasm and a willingness to learn

This position is NOT eligible for employment visa sponsorship for non-U.S. citizens.

FLSA STATUS:Non-Exempt

KeyCorp is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer committed to engaging a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Description:As a Software Engineering Intern at Lockheed Martin, you will join one of the largest networks of software professionals, implementing cutting edge technologies on both existing and new development products. You will be helping us solve the world’s most difficult challenges, developing industry leading technology and products in the areas such as: EO/IR Targeting and Surveillance Systems, Advanced Threat Warning Systems, Combat and Defense Missile development.

You will be involved in all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle; design, code, test, integration, verification and field integration support, facilitated by an Agile software development work flow. You will have the opportunity to utilize your skills in many different technical areas including: object oriented software development, real-time embedded development for multi-core and multi-processor systems, development for multiple operating systems (VxWorks, Linux, Windows), defensive cyber security/product protections, image/signal processing, image/inertial tracking, servo/mechanism controls, machine learning, image/data fusion, mission planning and field maintenance application development, other GUI development to support test and verification.

Basic Qualifications

Currently enrolled in an accredited degree program pursing a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Math, or related major.

Desired Skills

3.0 GPA or above

Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.

Experience Level

Co-op/Summer Intern

Description:At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters. Lockheed Martin builds the satellites and spacecraft that do amazing things in space for government and commercial customers. Connecting people. Advancing discovery. And protecting what matters most. Lockheed Martin-built satellites give earlier warning of severe weather, connect troops on the battlefield, and deliver GPS directions to a billion people worldwide.

As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. That’s why we’re crafting smarter satellites that operate like smartphones in the sky, with apps that can be updated in orbit so they can adapt as mission needs on the ground change. Your mission is ours. And as that mission evolves, we’ll be ready. Will you?

What does this role look like?
You will participate in engineering tasks supporting a systems engineering team. Working with experienced engineers, you will perform work in all systems engineering phases that could include requirements definition, allocation and maintenance. This position supports various system analyses in support of mission planning and execution.

This position requires special access to support the program and will be subject to certain citizenship requirements.

This opening supports a variety of Systems Engineering intern positions within Lockheed Martin Space in multiple Colorado locations. Some of these positions may require security clearances and may be subject to security investigation.

Locations Include:

Littleton, CO: Waterton Campus
Littleton, CO: Deer Creek Campus
Colorado Springs, CO
Denver, CO
Highlands Ranch, CO
Boulder, CO
Centennial, CO

Basic Qualifications

Actively enrolled in an Engineering, Physics, Math or other related degree program from an accredited college/university.

This position requires special access to support the program and selected candidate will be subject to certain citizenship requirements.

Desired Skills

Coursework in college level physics.
Knowledge and or training in the integration of requirements, design and technology during the design and development of complex systems.
Knowledge of product development life cycle a plus.
Knowledge of CAD and simulation tools.
Experience or classroom knowledge of analytical model development using Matlab or Simulink.
Detailed coding implementation with programming languages (C, C++).
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.

Mechanical
Electrical
Software
Computer Science
Computer Engineering
Physics
Math

Job Description

OneBeacon Insurance Group is currently seeking students who are technically savvy and interested in learning from a top IT team!

In this role you will have the opportunity to assist our Agile Applications Technology Team with the full systems development life cycle on a variety of applications. These are full-time paid 2021 summer internships in our Salem, VA office, located at 1051 Texas Street.

Job Responsibilities


Learn to build, maintain and support web-based Underwriting and Policy issuance applications.
Collaborate effectively with other members of the development team in an Agile environment. Be part of a Scrum team!
Learn myriad of systems and tools and participate in all phases of the full systems development life cycle.
Use your creativity to offer new solutions and introduce new ideas.

Qualifying candidates should have knowledge of a subset of the following:

Java Struts (MVC Framework)
Java JSF
VB.Net
Angular/JS, JQuery
C#.NET
Web Service development
SSRS
Subversion (Source Control)
AngularJS
ASP.Net
Agile Software Development - Scrum
Education & Experience:
As an Intern, you must be working towards or recently received a bachelor's degree and have taken some Computer Science coursework. Java experience strongly preferred.
Job Number
1195BR
Division
Corporate - IT
Location(s)
Salem VA
Country
United States

About Us

OneBeacon Insurance Group focuses on the unique risks faced by certain industry groups that we believe would benefit from specialized expertise, tailored products and an intense commitment to service. At OneBeacon, we believe that specialized expertise matters. Through our underwriting companies, we offer a broad range of specialty insurance products and services sold through independent agencies, regional and national brokers, wholesalers and managing general agencies. Each OneBeacon business is managed by an experienced team of specialty insurance professionals focused on a specific customer group or industry segment they know well.

position: Software Engineer Intern - Orlando, FL with Security Clearance
description:
Description:As a Software Engineering intern at Lockheed Martin, you will join one of the largest networks of software professionals, implementing cutting edge technologies on both existing and new development platforms. You will be helping us solve the world's most difficult challenges supporting such wide ranging domain areas such as aircraft flight command and control, air traffic control, Health Care, and Home Land Defense. Software professionals at Lockheed Martin have the opportunity to work with a variety of technologies such as Machine Learning and related Artificial Intelligence, Quantum Computing using one of the world's first quantum computers, Business applications such ERP, naval systems, radar systems, Business Intelligence/Analytics, working on a Infrastructure Service Provider (ISP) team, developing code to support wireless mobile technologies, spacecraft attitude control, software development, development of "green" technologies, Robotics, Oceanic exploration, missile combat systems, and virtual reality simulation platforms among other amazing software frontiers. You will be involved in all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle; design, code, test, integration and systems operations and will have the opportunity to utilize their skills in many different roles including: applying object oriented design using languages such as JAVA and C++, working on operating systems such as Unix, Red Hat and Windows, building code utilizing software development methodologies such as Agile, working on Enterprise architecture design such as Service Oriented Architecture, developing embedded Software, designing code for a .net framework using C#, performing COTS integration, and developing web applications to develop mission critical software solutions. A Software Engineer Intern will have the opportunity to leverage their information assurance skills to address some of the most complex cyber security challenges confronting our Nation including both defensive and offensive capabilities.

Basic Qualifications

Currently enrolled in an accredited degree program pursing a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Math, or related major

Desired Skills

−Knowledge of C++ and Java

Basic Qualifications

position: Software Engineering Intern - Orlando, FL with Security Clearance
description:
Description:As a Software Engineering Intern at Lockheed Martin, you will join one of the largest networks of software professionals, implementing cutting edge technologies on both existing and new development products. You will be helping us solve the world's most difficult challenges, developing industry leading technology and products in the areas such as: EO/IR Targeting and Surveillance Systems, Advanced Threat Warning Systems, Combat and Defense Missile development. You will be involved in all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle; design, code, test, integration, verification and field integration support, facilitated by an Agile software development work flow. You will have the opportunity to utilize your skills in many different technical areas including: object oriented software development, real-time embedded development for multi-core and multi-processor systems, development for multiple operating systems (VxWorks, Linux, Windows), defensive cyber security/product protections, image/signal processing, image/inertial tracking, servo/mechanism controls, machine learning, image/data fusion, mission planning and field maintenance application development, other GUI development to support test and verification.

Basic Qualifications

Currently enrolled in an accredited degree program pursing a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Math, or related major.

Desired Skills

3.0 GPA or above
Software development experience in C/C++
Familiarity and understanding of differences between relevant C++ standards (ie. C++98; C++11; C++17, etc)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with Software integration and debugging techniques.
Experience with Object Oriented design and associated documentation.
Detailed understanding of Operating System concepts/features/differences (Linux, VxWorks, Windows)
Experience with Software Continuous Integration (CI) toolchains/pipelines (configuration management, automated unit testing, static analysis, etc)
Experience with GUI development utilizing C++/Qt framework or C#

Basic Qualifications

You will have the opportunity to utilize your skills in many different technical areas including: object oriented software development, real-time embedded development for multi-core and multi-processor systems, development for multiple operating systems (VxWorks, Linux, Windows), defensive cyber security/product protections, image/signal processing, image/inertial tracking, servo/mechanism controls, machine learning, image/data fusion, mission planning and field maintenance application development, other GUI development to support test and verification.

Basic Qualifications

Currently enrolled in an accredited degree program pursing a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Math, or related major.

Desired Skills

3.0 GPA or above
Software development experience in C/C++
Familiarity and understanding of differences between relevant C++ standards (ie. C++98; C++11; C++17, etc)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with Software integration and debugging techniques.
Experience with Object Oriented design and associated documentation.
Detailed understanding of Operating System concepts/features/differences (Linux, VxWorks, Windows)
Experience with Software Continuous Integration (CI) toolchains/pipelines (configuration management, automated unit testing, static analysis, etc)
Experience with GUI development utilizing C++/Qt framework or C#

Basic Qualifications

Title: OPERATIONS INTERN

Department: Operations

Location: Initially Remote near New Orleans, LA




Raistone Capital (Raistone) originates, structures and syndicates trade finance assets globally. We combine the best qualities of an investment bank, a fintech and a start-up. We are a diverse mix of talented, energetic people who do amazing work. We are hiring builders, collaborators and innovators and we are looking for bright, motivated, reliable talent to join our small, nimble team.




Raistone is seeking a team focused intern to support the Operations of the company’s transaction processing of trade finance assets – typically accounts receivable. We are a small company, and this is a “hands-on” opportunity working closely with the Director of Operations. The position will comprise of business analysis, high touch processing, project work, and will include extensive activity within Salesforce. For this role, we are seeking an individual with financial aptitude and advanced technical capabilities interested in putting those skills to use to contribute to our continuous improvement and improved customer experience. Prior work for a financial services company (bank, factor, hedge fund, private equity, venture capital, trade finance, specialty finance) is helpful.




The successful candidate will report to the Director of Operations and will be a resource for the Chief Operating Officer as needed. The company’s leadership is committed to the personal and professional growth of the Raistone team. 




Key Responsibilities include:

· Support the sale, execution and monitoring of the origination and sale of trade finance assets (accounts receivable)

· Reconciliation and monitoring of incoming financial collections

· Bolster the client onboarding process by validating documents and configuring company systems consistent with client and business needs

· Assist our Customer Service team to delight our customers each day, which include Small and Medium-size Enterprises (SME) and some of the world’s largest Institutional Investors.

· Provide feedback regarding process improvements to increase operating efficiency and enhance controls.

· Curate PowerPoint and Vizio diagrams to help the team visualize existing and proposed operating processes

· Create and execute customized reporting and dashboards for both internal and external customer constituencies using advanced reporting tools such as Power BI, Salesforce, Tableau or other similar data presentation tools. Prior experience with these tools is helpful.

· Develop tools / automation to calculate customized referral payments to applicable parties




Qualifications and Skills

· Attention to detail and an ability to complete work accurately against strict deadlines

· 2+ years of post-secondary education with a major/concentration in computer science, finance, accounting, or economics preferred

· Proficiency with Salesforce is preferred

· Experience and working for a financial services company (bank, factor, hedge fund, private equity, venture capital, trade finance, specialty finance) is preferred

· Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel

· Experience using advanced Business Intelligence tools such as Power BI, Salesforce, Tableau or other similar data presentation tools. Prior experience with these tools is helpful.

· Organized and efficient, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task based on urgency of business needs

· Experience with trade finance products such Receivable Finance or Invoice Discounting would be helpful but is not required

· Ability to communicate effectively throughout all levels of the organization.




Qualified candidates are invited to submit a cover letter and resumé indicating qualifications.




Raistone Capital LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, disability (physical or mental), medical condition, marital status, ancestry, protected veteran status, genetics and any other protected group status or non-job related characteristics as directed by law.

WEX Inc. (NYSE: WEX) provides B2B payment processing and information management solutions. From our roots in fleet card payments beginning in 1983, we have expanded the scope of our business to a multi-channel provider of corporate payment solutions in fleet, virtual travel, and healthcare markets.

Our innovative technology, payment, and data solutions are working to enable our customers and business partners to focus on what they do best: achieve their business growth objectives.

WEX is more than just a corporate payment processing company and a job. We are an agile and innovative technology community, where our curious and collaborative people look to bring the future of commerce to the present.

Our Program

The WEX Technology Co-Op Internship offers a 12 week experience for students looking for work experience with the flexibility to attend school throughout the year. Our internship program is designed to provide interns hands-on, practical experiences while working alongside some of our industry’s smartest teams; as well as providing immediate value to their teams and our leaders.

As an intern, you will be challenged and offered the opportunity to make an impact across the business and be involved in the company’s most critical business decisions.We are looking for ambitious and curious students, who are interested in growing professionally and developing their skills to become the next generation of leaders in technology.

We are specifically looking for engineers and developers interested in Information Security (Cyber Security), Cloud Architect and Operations, Mobile WEB and App Development, UX/UI, Software QA, and Software Development.

What You Will Be Doing In This Role

Our team is looking for a Scrum Master Co-Op Intern . This position will support the Global Fleet Technology team on a number of key initiatives that support the delivery of value to customers and help transform our internal software development practices. ** This is a remote position.

You Will Be

Promoting adherence to Agile software development best practices and ceremonies.
Helping teams to manage risks and dependencies as well as identify and remove impediments.
Reviewing and interpreting metrics and other key performance indicators (KPI) in order to drive continuous improvement for the sprint teams.
Partnering with other Scrum Masters to identify and manage dependencies



You Should Expect

A collaborative and challenging working environment
The opportunity to engage with various stakeholders across the business
Mentorship from senior leaders in Global Fleet Technology
The opportunity to hone your skills as a servant leader



Who We Are Looking For

At a minimum you should be pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management or a similar discipline with an anticipated graduation date in 2021 or 2022.
Outstanding written and oral communication skills.
Basic understanding of Agile methodology, metrics and reporting tools such as Daily Stand-ups / Huddles, Velocity, and Cumulative Flow.
Comfort in coaching and influencing others.
Strong project management skills, including planning and execution
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presenting information
Strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills
Strong interpersonal, leadership and communication skills
Ability to work in a dynamic, collaborative environment

company: Anderson ZurMuehlen Certified Public Accountants & Business Advisors
description:
Anderson ZurMuehlen is committed to providing top university and college business students with the opportunity to experience IT in a secure environment. Teamed with a mentor, you'll receive "real life" experience through interactions with staff, project teams and by handling real-time issues and deadlines. Expected start date is January 2021.

As an intern, you support the Anderson ZurMuehlen Technology Services (AZTS) team in a variety of ways. You will:

Assist with maintenance of hardware, software, and other systems.
Troubleshoot issues with equipment such as printers, computers, and servers.
Run software updates or backups as needed.
Assist with the development of new desktops, servers or applications.
Research technical issues or bugs encountered.
To be eligible to participate, you must:

Be enrolled in a degreed computer science, information technology or engineering program with a minimum 3.0 GPA.
Have basic knowledge of programming, database management, and technologies like MS SQL, Exchange, Access and .Net frameworks.
Comply with our mission statement, dress code, and uphold client confidentiality.
Be in good standing with your college or university.



Compensation

$13-$15/hour

If you are a self-motivated IT student who is interested in our Technology Service internship, apply online and include your resume, letter of interest, and unofficial transcript by 10/30/2020.

If you have any questions, please contact Human Resources at (406) 442-1040 or email HR@azworld.com .

Are you ready to join a growing team that puts a premium on productivity and has an award-winning culture, centered around transforming talented employees into effective business leaders?

Then Bankers Healthcare Group is the place for you. We offer innovative financial solutions to licensed and highly-skilled professionals, representing the best of both traditional lending and fintech, and are looking for passionate, impact players to help take our company to the next level.

At BHG, you’ll become immersed in the finance industry—with a variety of loan solutions, credit cards, patient financing, bank programs, and collections services, which have helped BHG become one of the leading providers of finance solutions.

With over 18 years in business, we have the stability of an established company with the speed and agility of a startup, where ingenuity and risk-taking are encouraged, and every employee has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.

Who You Are

You are a motivated student or recent graduate student who is passionate about business analytics. You excel at collecting, organizing and analyzing data while helping to develop conclusions and recommendations through BI tools and have experience identifying trends and opportunities. You are a logical and analytical thinker and thrive in a fast-paced environment where you will perform complex data analysis in supporting strategic business needs and transform raw data into finished products.

Life at BHG

At BHG, we work hard and aren’t afraid to take risks. Since the beginning, our core values of PMA (positive mental attitude), team player and loyalty have been the driving force behind every interaction we have between each other and our customers. We have a healthy respect for the daily grind, yet we value work/life balance. We believe that all employees should have the opportunity to lead and that good ideas can come from anyone. From the top-down, our leaders are actively involved not only in strategic oversight and running the business, but also in the well-being and growth of all employees. We consider people our #1 asset, and help employees realize their full potential, set and exceed their goals, and explore new opportunities for personal and professional development.

What You'll Do

Work within the analytics and data management department at BHG
Assuring the integrity of raw data, including data extraction, storage, manipulation, QC, processing and analysis.
Provide strategic and tactical support to the team by analyzing and interpreting business data to provide innovative solutions
Discussing business intelligence needs or information with analytics team and internal staff
Analyzing data with standard statistical methods, interpreting the results, and providing a written summary of data analysis
This person must be able to analyze data sets and come up with strategic solutions within different aspects of the company, including but not limited to: marketing, sales, employee performance, client profiling, credit, and risk


What You'll Need

Proficient with SQL, Power BI, Excel, and PowerPoint; R, Python are plus
Strong analytical, problem solving, and critical thinking skills
Intellectual curiosity and aptitude to pick up new technical skills and domain knowledge
Excited to collaborate and eager to learn
Driven and ambitious
Great team player
Strong written and verbal communications
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering or related quantitative fields, graduating in 2021 Spring or Summer are plus


Why You Should Join BHG

Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect when you join BHG include

We strive to offer amenities, opportunities, events, and programming that support the interests of our teams, while furthering the culture that makes us Great Place to Work® certified.


100% coverage of monthly health insurance premiums
Competitive PTO and vacation policies
Company 401(k) plan with employer contributions after one year
On-site gym access and memberships, with personal trainers, and certified nutritionists on staff
Company-sponsored training and certification opportunities
Monthly award ceremonies where top achievers are celebrated and receive additional bonuses
Ongoing volunteer opportunities to give back to the community through our BHG Cares program


If you’re ready for a career where you can exercise your passions, be surrounded by co-workers who are relentlessly committed to service, and have a team-player mindset, apply today!

Bankers Healthcare Group is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Our technology operations internship is an intensive 10-week experience with our frontline technology teams that are responsible for managing, monitoring, and improving the real-time trading environment at Jump Trading.

You will be working directly with our experienced systems and network engineers, gaining broad technical and operational knowledge across all aspects of the trading platform and technology stack. Our internship program is the primary way we identify top young system engineers for our Technology Operations teams, paving the path toward earning full-time opportunities at Jump.

We are looking for bright and highly motivated individuals that want to grow their knowledge of systems and networking, understanding of modern trading at scale, and practical DevOps-based software engineering skills.

What you'll do:

The Tech Ops Intern will work with traders, operations, exchanges, and developers to optimize the trading environment and investigate and solve system issues.


Build automation to manage and improve the production trading environment
Proactively monitor the overall health and performance of the trading platform
Work closely with our world-class technology organization to:
Analyze and troubleshoot complex system, software, and networking infrastructure issues
Design, implement and optimize network infrastructure for proprietary low latency trading applications at various data centers throughout the world
Work closely with risk management and trading teams to coordinate changes and manage incidents
Manage and assess operational risk of change control into the production environment
Define and document process and procedure
Other duties as assigned or needed


Skills you'll need:


Major in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Systems, or related technical field
Experience working with Linux/UNIX OS including advanced commands and shell scripts
Practical working knowledge of python
Understanding of networking concepts such as routing, multicast, ethernet
A rigorous, detail-oriented approach to operations
Ability to operate and communicate clearly under pressure
Desire to work in a collaborative, team environment with a positive can do attitude
Reliable and predictable availability

WEC Energy Group is currently seeking applicants for May 2021 summer & year round Audit Internships based out of the following locations: Green Bay-WI and Milwaukee-WI.

We employ students for summer and year round opportunities to help design creative cost effective systems and equipment that keep the energy flowing to our customers in a safe and reliable manner. Our student employees have the opportunity to make a difference in people’s lives every day. Together, we can make a world of difference!

Document, evaluate, and test the adequacy of process design and application of financial and operational controls to mitigate risks at a reasonable cost in accordance with professional standards.

eSight is an organization that strives to create a more inclusive world and help people living with visual impairments and legal blindness to See New Possibilities.

This belief has driven us to invent a truly novel technology - breakthrough, electronic glasses that significantly enhance vision for people with visual impairments. We offer a life-changing solution for thousands of people. Enjoy some of their stories . They will likely leave you with a lump in your throat or a tear in your eye. We are a cutting-edge organization that is passionately driven by our vision to impact the world with life-changing, customer-centric technology.

Are you a "techie" interested in helping with all aspects of testing and software programming? If so, you may be our next Software Engineering Intern!

Role And Responsibilities

Perform functional testing and programming to ensure the software meets all dimensions of quality and reliability.
Assist with the designs and development of automated tests.
Be a part of a small team and do real work that will have a meaningful impact to improve product quality and yield
Working under the guidance of eSight's senior Software Engineers, this role will have a hands-on, design-driven contribution to the delivery of high quality products to our customers.
A high degree of team participation and cooperation is essential.
Working closely with hardware and systems designers, other software developers, test engineers, and external partners.

Skills Requirements

Currently completing a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Systems Engineering.
Experienced with software design processes.
Strong understanding of Python and SQL (BONUS assets: C, C++, Java, Javascript)
Familiarity with hardware is a nice to have.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.

This is a fall term internship/co-op opportunity, from September 8 - December 18, with full time availability. This position requires office presence located at our Kanata office. eSight is carefully monitoring the changing situation with COVID and is operating safely as per provincial and federal regulations for essential business.

You must be an actively enrolled post-secondary student fitting the requirements for ‘Student Work Place Program’ to be eligible for this role (https://www.biotalent.ca/student-work-placement-program-student-page/).

position: Summer 2021 Intern - Software Engineer - San Francisco
description: _To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts._**Job Category**Intern**Job Details**This is your time to shine. Our software engineering interns are considered full-time employees by their peers. In fact, you will be expected to contribute right away as a member of our Engineering teams for future releases. As the world leader in enterprise cloud computing, we release 3 new versions every year with close to 100 new features each release. You will write code that reaches millions of subscribers who use a number of our applications ranging from Marketing Cloud, Service Cloud and Security to just name a few. Additionally, you will work on our automated testing infrastructure and craft the tools that provide real-time monitoring of our service. With such a quick turnaround, we dont want our interns to sit on the sidelines and enjoy the view we want you to change the way our customers connect their business to the world!As a Futureforce intern, you will not only get to contribute to the meaningful work our teams are doing, but you will also have the opportunity to interact with senior executives and network with a number of employees at Salesforce. In addition to these impactful opportunities, ensuring that you get to participate in a number of events outside of your day-to-day duties is something that is top of mind for us. Throughout the summer, you will get to attend reoccurring Lunch and Learns where you will hear from a number of different representatives from the business about their career paths, attend events that take place outside of the office such as local Baseball games and finally, you will have the opportunity to give back to the community through a number of organized volunteer events. At Salesforce, we care deeply about the work that you do as an intern and additionally want to ensure that you are provided ample opportunities to create meaningful connections with other Salesforce employees as well as other students from across the country during your summer in the office.**Key Responsibilities:**+ Work under the direction of software architects and senior developers on a project that you will get to present to other interns and Salesforce Developers+ Work with your team members on timely and relevant projects that may be included in a future software release+ Contribute to our suite of automated tests and testing infrastructure**Required Skills:**+ Enrolled and working towards obtaining a BS or MS in Computer Science or related field. Please note that in order to be eligible for an internship, we require that you be returning to school the following quarter/semester to work towards completing your degree+ Must be attending a University in North America+ Academic or professional/internship experience working in a professional coding setting is a plus+ Understanding of object-oriented programming/design+ Strong understanding of CS fundamentals and how to apply them to code+ Understanding of algorithms and data structures and how to efficiently implement them into a solution+ Ability to produce clear, efficient and concise code**Desired Skills:**+ Team-player with the ability to work effectively and efficiently with others+ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills+ Commitment to putting quality first and delivering quality solutions+ Be a self-starter and possess a strong sense of self-motivation+ Ability to quickly learn new technologies+ Coursework in SQL and relational database concepts+ Strong competency in javascript and associated frameworks+ Working knowledge of HTML and web technologies+ General knowledge of front end and back end languages**About Futureforce University Recruiting**Our Futureforce University Recruiting program is dedicated to attracting, retaining and cultivating talent. Our interns and new graduates work on real projects that affect how our business runs, giving them the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the future of our company.With offices all over the world, our recruits have the chance to collaborate and connect with fellow employees on a global scale. We offer job shadowing, mentorship programs, talent development courses, and much more.**Accommodations** If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. at ail.salesforce.com/accommodations-request-form**Posting Statement**At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Companies of every size and industry are using Salesforce to transform their businesses, across sales, service, marketing, commerce, and more by connecting with customers in a whole new way. We harness technologies that can revolutionize companies, careers, and, hopefully, our world.Salesforce is built on a set of four core values: Trust, Customer Success, Innovation, and Equality. Anduril is a defense technology company, bringing Silicon Valley talent and funding to the defense sector. Our technology helps our customers solve their toughest challenges by enabling them to make better, more informed decisions in life-and-death situations. We've assembled a diverse team of specialists in artificial intelligence, computer vision, sensor fusion, optics, and data analysis that are creating software and hardware solutions to radically evolve the capabilities of the United States and our allies.If you are passionate about solving problems that have real impact, come join Anduril and build the future of defense.About The RoleAnduril's Lattice software platform integrates together many sensors into a single cohesive view of the world, providing needed context for our users. Software engineers at Anduril build the systems that run on our autonomous assets, the networking and backend services that integrate large amounts of sensor data, and the user interfaces that display that data in real time.We believe in having as little separation between engineers and our users as well as between engineering teams. As a Software Engineer Intern, you will be working alongside a team of engineers with a diverse set of backgrounds and skills. Anduril has a collaborative culture with plenty of opportunities for ownership. As a member of the team, your decisions today will have a large impact on the company now and into the future, as well as our customers!We believe that simple systems are easier to understand, maintain, and scale. You will be making trade-offs as you work to ensure that our systems are prepared to scale - so being able to effectively communicate these trade-offs with your teammates is a must.Responsibilities* Engineers are responsible for the full product lifecycle, including design, implementation, deployment, and maintenance.* Collaborate with cross-functional internal hardware & software teams to incorporate their innovations and vice versa.* Take feedback to iterate on and improve Anduril's software systems.Qualifications* Prior engineering internship experience, along with current academic pursuits & studies in the areas of: Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics.* Approaching Junior year or beyond at the time of the internship.* Familiarity with algorithms, data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools.* Proficiency in a variety of programming languages such as Go, Java, C++, Python, JavaScript, etc.* A desire to work on software and applications that have real-world impact.Individuals Should* Have a bias for action. If you see a problem, you want to solve and fix it.* Be naturally curious about the technologies and tools you use.* Have a point-of-view, but are still low-ego.Technologies We Use* Front end TypeScript and React* Networking / backend systems: Java and Go* Sensor processing systems: Rust/C++* Build tooling: Nix/CMake/Cargo* Deployment tooling: NixOS/KubernetesU.S. Person status may be required as this position needs to access export controlled data.

If you're looking to join a global team of exceptional people, committed to designing, delivering and supporting best-in-class technology solutions in a fast paced, results-oriented and growing company - Belden is for you. Job Summary

I.T is critical to the success of an organization and the teams that support this area don't just have responsibility for information management, they take accountability for the seamless lifecycle of networking, systems and database operations as well as security management all of which enhance the business#s ability to operate successfully.

Responsibilities

Internship opportunities in our I.T teams offer current students an opportunity to work on important business projects, collaborate with experienced managers and deliver real results for the organization. At Belden, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. These statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work involved for this job. It is not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of this job.
This company is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, gender, disability, or protected veteran status.

Who We Are

Samsara, founded in 2015, is a leader in Industrial IoT and our mission is to increase the efficiency, safety, and sustainability of the operations that power our economy. Our solutions combine hardware and software to bring real-time visibility, analytics, and AI to operations across various industries. Samsara’s fast-growing team is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in San Jose, Atlanta, and London. Our team has raised $930M from Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst, Tiger Global, Dragoneer, AllianceBernstein Holding LP, Franklin Templeton, General Atlantic, Sands Capital Management and Warburg Pincus LLC.

At Samsara, we welcome all. All sizes, colors, cultures, sexes, beliefs, religions, ages, people. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.

About The Role

We are looking for talented engineers to join our data science team! Please note we only have internship opportunities during Summer 2021.

The Software Engineering Intern, Data Science will be a core technical contributor to the team. They will be tasked with analyzing large volumes of complex data, building models to help answer pressing business questions or build customer-facing data products, and summarizing / visualizing their findings for both technical and non-technical audiences. The Software Engineering Intern, Data Science will work closely with technical and business leadership for the product or functional they are aligned to and iterate on the output with stakeholders.

About The Team

Come help us build out the Data Science function at Samsara! To support Samsara’s exponential growth, the Data Science team Data Science team is focused on 3 core areas:


Help Samsara and our customers solve their toughest problems through data (including building both internal and customer facing data products)
Enable Samsara teams to be more data savvy by building high quality data assets, sharing best practices, and providing training and consultations
Ensure the integrity of our data to help us confidently make important business decisions

Members of Data Science will work cross-functionally with other teams across Samsara, getting an opportunity to interact with diverse data sets, including our large volumes of time-series sensor data (nearly 3M data points collected every minute!)

Examples Of Day-to-day Responsibilities

Leveraging SQL or Python to shape and structure large, complex data sets for analysis
Building statistical, quantitative, or machine learning models to identify patterns, anomalies, and root causes (e.g., using telemetry data to detect vehicle anomalies)
Meeting with technical and non-technical stakeholders to understand data structures and determine business priorities
Creating data visualizations, data products, and other summary output to support decision-making from operational and leadership teams



Requirements

Coursework in engineering or quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, etc.)
Experience with data manipulation and processing, preferably in SQL or Python (e.g., using PySpark)
Experience building statistical, machine learning, and other analytical models, preferably in Python (e.g., using TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.)
Familiarity managing data science code via GitHub
Comfortable reading and understanding full-stack development code (e.g., Go, Java, ReactJs) to understand data logging / instrumentation, or to build front-end data components
Preferred: Some experience with data visualization (e.g., using Javascript or Python libraries)
Preferred: Some prior internship experience in data science or data engineering role
Preferred: Experience implementing and optimizing machine learning models on very large datasets (1B+ records)


Working at Samsara has its perks: private medical and dental insurance, flexible vacation, growth and development opportunities, regular virtual team and company events. Post COVID, we’ll be back in our global offices with numerous in-office perks.

Regarding COVID-19

With the spread of COVID-19 globally, Samsara's offices will remain closed until further notice with the exception of phase 1 employees that require access to hardware and lab equipment.

Our primary concern is for the health and well-being of our employees as well as candidates. We have transitioned all interviews and new hire onboarding to be conducted virtually via Zoom video conferencing. We have allowed employees to work from countries and states where Samsara is a registered entity through June 2021. All employees (except field roles) are expected to return to our offices when they reopen.

Samsara, founded in 2015, is a leader in Industrial IoT and our mission is to increase the efficiency, safety, and sustainability of the operations that power our economy. About The Role

We are looking for talented engineers to join our full-stack teams! Please note we only have internship opportunities during Summer 2021. Full-stack, backend focus engineers design and develop features across a broad surface area with tangible impact on active and future customers. You will tackle engineering challenges ranging from architecting data structures for mass data collection to presenting data analytics in intuitive and performant ways on web and mobile.

Full-stack, frontend focus engineers develop user interfaces that present the data collected from thousands of devices in intuitive ways. You will work directly with the design and product teams to identify solutions and iterate quickly based on feedback. The features you build will provide actionable insights for our customers’ operations, and may involve anything from developing our design systems to performance engineering.

We use Golang for our firmware and backend, Typescript and React for our web client, GraphQL to fetch data from our backend, and React Native for our mobile app. Direct experience with these technologies is not required.

An Ideal Candidate Would

Complete a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field between Fall/Winter 2021- Summer 2022
Have built or worked on production applications
Enjoy understanding our users and what would make their day to day processes easier to manage
Love shipping features that are immediately used by our customers
Seek to iterate on new products based on customer feedback
Champion, role model, and embed Samsara’s cultural principles (Obsess Over the Customer, Build for the Long Term, Growth Mindset) as we scale globally and across new offices

Job Category Intern Job Details What you'll be doing… The Enterprise Applications Software Engineer Intern partners with existing Enterprise Applications Engineers to design and develop solutions to existing business problems. A few more things you'll be working on... *
Work with architects, development leads and developers to architect and design solutions. * Embed with a Scrum team and work within our existing Software Development Lifecycle to implement code changes to support the solution. * Partner with customers, support, and QA staff to resolve bugs and support issues. * Work with Application Administrators and Release Management staff to ensure release readiness of the project. * Create documentation for future supportability and production readiness. Who you are… *
Rock Star Student. Undergraduate college student in computer science or relevant field * Knowledgeable. Interest in databases, visualization and/or software development Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. position: Summer 2021 Intern - Software Engineer - Tableau - Seattle
description: _To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts._**Job Category**Intern**Job Details**Tableau helps people see and understand data. We design products that are fast, easy, and beautifulproducts that anyone can use to solve problems and make a difference in the world.People at Tableau are builders, tinkerers, and collaborators. Our teams are constantly bringing their deep expertise, skill sets and ideas together to drive new features and products that improve peoples livesyoull do real work and make an impact, immediately.Want to write code for Tableaus latest releases that will reach more than a million people around the globe? Navigate large-scale, complex technical challenges in a fast development cycle? Receive world-class mentorship and connect with some of the brightest people in the industry? Oh, and have a blast while youre doing it? Join our 2021 Tableau intern class! Not only will you build great products, you get to hear from our leadership, attend intern-exclusive events, give back to your community through volunteer events and more. Discover a summer of new opportunities and experience what sets Tableau apart.**What you'll be doing...**As a Software Engineer Intern, you will work on joint projects right alongside your very own mentor and manager. Over a 12 to 16-week time period, youll work in an area within Tableaus forward-thinking product interests such as Data, Analytics, AtScale, Product Operations, User Experience and Platform and Infrastructure. Your specific project will be determined a few months before you start, but dont worry well get your input before making placements. The best part is, the work you do will be included as part of a shipping project within six to twelve months.**A few more things you'll be working on...** Designing and implementing features in existing and new products. Authoring automated tests (unit test and black box tests) and other development processes. Working with customers, support, and QA to resolve bugs and support issues. Reviewing and providing detailed feedback on documentation and test plans for features.**Who you are...** Rock Star Student. Pursuing your Undergrad, Masters or PhD in Computer Science or a related field. A True Team Player. You enjoy thoughtfully collaborating, learning from or teaching others so we can all become better developers. Passionate. You are enthusiastic about technology and the work you do. You believe in and are dedicated to advancing our mission. You always want to do your best to delight customers, help your team and strive for excellence.**Accommodations** If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. at ail.salesforce.com/accommodations-request-form**Posting Statement**At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. Salesforce.com at om/ and Salesforce.org at rg/ will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesfore.com at om/ or Salesforce.org.Salesforce welcomes all.Founded in 1999, Salesforce is the global leader in Customer Relationship Management (CRM). Companies of every size and industry are using Salesforce to transform their businesses, across sales, service, marketing, commerce, and more by connecting with customers in a whole new way. We harness technologies that can revolutionize companies, careers, and, hopefully, our world.Salesforce is built on a set of four core values: Trust, Customer Success, Innovation, and Equality. By making technology more accessible, we're helping create a future with greater opportunity and equality for all. This has taken our company to great heights, including being ranked by Fortune as one of the Most Admired Companies in the World and one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For eleven years in a row, and named Innovator of the Decade and one of the Worlds Most Innovative Companies eight years in a row by Forbes.There are those who choose to work with the best and brightest. And then, there are those who want to do more than just a job. They are the ones improving lives, not only their careers. Having an impact now instead of later. Doing something thats so much bigger than themselves, an industry, and their company.We believe everyone can be a Trailblazer. Join Salesforce and discover a future of new opportunities.

Job Details

Description

CBORD and Horizon are the world’s leading providers of integrated technology solutions powering housing, access, foodservice, nutrition, eCommerce, and card systems for K-12 and higher education, acute care, senior living, and business campuses. Our success and growth is directly attributed to our DREAMteam. Our culture is built on integrity, respect for our people, and continuous personal development. We maintain an entrepreneurial spirit, where creativity, innovative problem solving, and learning agility drive our day-to-day actions.

DREAMteam (how we refer to all of us) You’re engaged and self-motivated. You think like an entrepreneur, constantly driving improvement and innovation. You act as a change agent. You’re a team player contributing to a collaborative and diverse work environment. We question the status quo and so should you. You are accountable and focused and take smart risks. You’re an extension of our talent acquisition team – always scouting top talent to join our team.

The Software Engineer Intern assists the Development team with tasks related to testing including writing test plans, software code, and testing scripts. This individual is actively involved in all phases of the software development life cycle and must communicate proactively and effectively with team members on issues.

What You’ll Be Doing

This position is responsible for translating business and user requirements into system tests; executing manual Functional tests; maintaining system test strategies; executing and programming software tests; and conducting technical discussions with internal development partners to understand their designs and intended output.

Software Engineer Intern include the following. This position has no management responsibilities. The candidate may be required to perform other related duties as assigned.

Individual may be given tasks/requirements in all areas of software development and support based upon project and scheduling requirements.
Assignments will be defined specifically with the intention of allowing the individual to develop independent software engineering skills in the area of software maintenance and new development.
Where possible, assignments will become more complex as the individual demonstrates the ability to accept increasingly complex tasks.
Tools Used: PHP, Javascript, JQuery, XCode (iOS) Android OS, C/C++, Cloud/VM, VB Net, C#, Visual Basic, Windows, Oracle, Perl, Linux, PHP.
Actively participate in product planning and other requirements gathering
Participate in special or customer-specific projects as assigned
Research and develop an understanding of the marketing requirements for the product, including how the product is actually used by CBORD customers

Education Preferred

What You’ll Bring to the Table

Actively enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree program in one of the following disciplines: Software Engineering or Engineering, Computer Science, or a Business Major with a Technical Minor.

Experience Desired

Less than 18 months of experience in development, research, and product testing

Competencies

Basic communication skills with the ability to work effectively in a team
Ability to work from own initiative, learn and adapt quickly, and be highly productive
Ability to create multiple “what-if” scenarios putting yourself in customer’s shoes and apply all the scenarios in the workflow of the application
Proven knowledge of the software development life cycle and solid understanding of quality software
Basic programing and scripting skills, preferably in an object oriented programming language
Ability to apply basic test strategy knowledge and methodologies to design, develop, and execute general software tests
Analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects under general supervision
Awareness of business issues as they impact overall project plans
