The Student Program is part of the Academic Services division of University Information Technology. The Director of Student Programs leads the student administrative systems group, and is responsible for developing and achieving agreed upon goals and outcomes for the portfolio of student administrative systems used at the University. The Director works closely with a variety of administrative and information systems professionals to improve alignment of student administration systems strategies across the Universitys three campuses and Continuum College. The Director is also part of the Academic Services leadership group, charged with developing IT strategies to meet the evolving needs of students and faculty at the University.

This position will build consensus, drive decisions within a diverse population of stakeholders, and successfully achieve the goals and outcomes defined for the student program. The successful applicant must possess strong communication, negotiation and issue resolution skills to serve as a successful liaison between the University and the campus community.

Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Information Science, Computer Science, or related field or experience.
Six years’ experience in the following:
Experience and demonstrated success building partnerships that span organizational silos
Demonstrated ability to develop and execute multi-year strategic and operational plans
Experience leading organizational change in coordination with implementing technical improvements
Demonstrated ability and experience supervising staff and leading technical teams
Demonstrated ability to facilitate complex program governance and decision making
Ability to effectively resolve escalated issues and risks, whether directly or working with program executive sponsors
Experience in managing projects in diverse subject areas with the ability to quickly "climb the learning curve" in new subject areas
Strong knowledge and experience in project and product lifecycle management
Knowledge of project management "best practices", group dynamics, team building and facilitation skills
Experience in extensive engagement of end users in the process of project management
Excellent oral and written communications skills; interaction abilities and demonstrated and committed to provide excellent customer service
Strong office and project organizational skills, attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines
Ability to grasp technical concepts quickly and effectively

Equivalent education/experience will substitute for all minimum qualifications except when there are legal requirements, such as a license/certification/registration.

Desired

Expert knowledge of student administration processes in higher education
Experience working in an institution of higher education
Experience with student information related applications
Knowledge of compliance and reporting requirements related to academic programs
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or training
Knowledge of ITIL
Experience with ERP replacement projects (especially with regards to student information systems)
Experience w/ vendor management and SaaS models for service delivery


Conditions Of Employment

Responsibility to work varied hours as needed to meet deadlines and to accomplish work assignments on which others’ activities depend. Daily leadership and oversite of team members, subject matter experts and stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Expected to work overtime as necessary to accomplish scope of duties.
This position is eligible for flexible remote work
Open office environment

position: IT Helpdesk Technician Intern - Peoria Heights
description: JOB SUMMARYPearl Insurance is currently seeking a part-time, Helpdesk Technician Intern. This is a great opportunity for college students and recent graduates. The position offers 25 to 29 hours per week with flexible scheduling. It also has the potential to transition into a full-time, regular position in the future.The Helpdesk Technician Intern is responsible for providing technical assistance and support related to computer systems, hardware, and/or software to internal users. Responds to service/incident requests, performs routine operational activities, runs diagnostic programs, isolates problems, and determines and implements solutions.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.* Log and respond to incoming IT service desk calls and service requests/tickets and provide desktop and application support to troubleshoot internal user problems. Diagnose, research and resolve problems within scope of ability; forward more complex problems to upper level support providers. Provide ongoing communication to end users regarding issue status.* Review incoming electronic service requests for completeness and assign appropriate priority.* Handle customer incidents, requests, and complaints with a positive and diplomatic attitude.* Execute and monitor batch jobs in accordance with operational schedule or as required. Run scheduled audit processes, database updates and maintenance programs. Maintain documentation for each process or batch.* Maintain Pearl Companies asset management process.* Maintain Pearl Companies backup tape management process.* Present a professional image of Pearl Companies at all times. Maintain professional appearance and conduct.* Maintain and update technical knowledge, skills, and certifications through on-the-job training, reading, seminars, classes, web research, and other educational resourcesQUALIFICATIONS* Associate's degree in computer science or related field or currently working towards obtaining a degree; 1+ years of IT system maintenance experience with an emphasis in network and desktop support; or equivalent combination of education and experience.* Strong interpersonal skills with a proven ability to interface with both technical and business team members at all levels within an organization.

The Data Science and Systems Security Department (http://www.nec-labs.com/research-departments/data-science-systems-research/data-science-systems-research-home) aims to build novel big data solutions and service platforms that simplify complex computer systems management, and to develop new information technology that supports innovative applications, from big data analytics to the Internet of Things. Our research is both experimental and theoretical, covering many domains in data science and systems research, such as: time series mining, graph mining, text mining, anomaly detection, signal processing, cloud computing, data centers, software-defined networking and streaming processing. The goal of our research is to fully understand the dynamics of big data from complex systems, retrieve patterns to profile them and build innovative solutions to help end user managing those systems. We have built a number of analytic engines and system solutions to process and analyze big data and support various applications in detection, prediction and optimization. Our research leads to both award-winning NEC products and publications in top conferences.Currently, the group has multiple fall/winter intern positions available for self-motivated graduate students in the area of artificial intelligence, machine learning and data mining. Interns are expected to conduct research with massive data from physical and IT systems and build applications to solve real and complex problems.

Brighter futures start here. BrightView takes pride in providing consistent, high-quality landscape services with a dependable service commitment. As the nation’s leading landscape services company, BrightView provides, through its team of more than 18,000 employees, services ranging from landscape maintenance and enhancements to tree care and landscape development for thousands of customers’ properties, including corporate and commercial properties, HOAs, public parks, hotels and resorts, hospitals and other healthcare facilities, educational institutions, restaurants and retail, and golf courses, among others. Estimating
Landscape Enhancements per design team

Proficient with computer software programs including MS Office suite (Word, Excel and Outlook)
Self-motivated to work on tasks
Must have effective oral and written communication skills
Must be able to prioritize and multi-task in a fast paced environment
Must have a strong work ethic


Preferred Educational Status

Pursuing a bachelors or associates degree in any areas of Horticulture such as the following: Landscape Architecture, Civil Engineering, Construction Science, Construction Management, Agriculture-Business, Landscape Design or Plant Science

Goodyear. More Driven.

Company Information

Goodyear is one of the world’s largest tire companies. It employs about 63,000 people and manufactures its products in 46 facilities in 21 countries around the world. Its two Innovation Centers in Akron, Ohio and Colmar-Berg, Luxembourg strive to develop state-of-the-art products and services that set the technology and performance standard for the industry. At Goodyear, we embrace the diversity of our workforce and value the contribution of our associates. We strive to provide associates with a safe work environment, the resources they need to do their jobs, and ample opportunities for growth. These objectives, coupled with competitive compensation and benefits, allow us to foster an environment where associates can work to achieve their full potential and contribute to the company's success. For more information, go to www.goodyear.com/corporate.

Global Information Technology - Cyber - Description

The Global Information Technology organization works closely with all other functional areas of the business including Finance, Marketing, Manufacturing, Research and Development, and Retail to support Goodyear’s activities. Areas of focus include, but are not limited to:

Business Process Analysis
Applications Support & Development
Project Management
Enterprise Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence
IT Infrastructure
Cyber Security, Risk Management, and Access Management
Manufacturing Operations
Retail Point-of-Sales Solutions
Enterprise Resource Planning (SAP)


About The Information Technology Internship Program

Goodyear offers paid internships to qualified actively enrolled students. Experiences will include challenging hands-on opportunities and networking with professionals in your field. Potential assignments will be in the areas listed above and may rotate according to the interest and skills of the individual. The term of the assignment can be either a full-time 10-12 week summer internship or a one-year internship, consisting of full-time work over the summer and part-time work during the school year. The goal of this program is to build a pipe-line of candidates for Goodyear’s IT Development Program which is designed to develop graduates into future high performing IT Professionals through broad exposure to various business and technical disciplines. In addition to challenging, engaging, and interesting work assignments, interns have the opportunity to meet and interact with other IT interns, as well as interns in other functional areas and from different schools. Educational and social events are conducted during and after work hours to help interns learn more about Goodyear. Several Goodyear leaders present various topics to help interns begin to think about significant business issues and their career options. Interns even have the opportunity to speak with the Goodyear Senior Leadership Team.

Applicant Requirements

Education and Qualifications

Minimum 3.0 overall GPA required
Must be actively pursuing a Bachelor’s degree.
Preferred majors include: Management Information Systems, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other business/technology related disciplines.
Strong analytical, problem solving skills, communication, and interpersonal skills


Ideal Candidates

Have a passion for technology
Seek a wide range of opportunities for growth and development
Value and appreciate diversity and working in a global environment
Excel in project work and delivering results
Prefer a culture of open communication and want to contribute in a team setting
Are fast learners who are able to keep up with the rapidly changing technological field
Are able to self-manage

About the company:

Kuaishou is a short video social platform for all users to record and share their lives, with the core mission to "Capture the World, Share Your Story" to increase every individual's happiness through Big Data and AI technology.

Kuaishou is one of the world's leading life-sharing community with more than 300 million daily active users and more than 20 billion short videos at the end of January 2020.

Kuaishou enables users to record their daily lives in short videos and share memorable moments as well as interact with followers in real-time through live streaming. For the first time in history, users from all over the world are connected and their stories shared in the form of video at Kuaishou.

You may visit https://www.kuaishou.com/ to learn more about us. 




About the Position:

We are an applied research and engineering team responsible for developing advanced AI technologies and hardware platforms for efficient inferences on cloud servers or edge devices across Kuaishou products. We are looking for Deep Learning Software Interns at our Palo Alto Office to develop exciting technologies for Kuaishou’s next generation products.




JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Evaluate hardware acceleration modules for various AI applications on

FPGA to solve the computing bottleneck of current heterogeneous

platforms

• Implement deep learning accelerators and algorithms on FPGA or GPU

• Train deep learning models on computing clusters to perform audio and

visual recognition tasks

• Cooperate with hardware and software engineers to complete product

integration and testing

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

• Creativity and curiosity for solving highly complex problems

• Excellent communication and collaboration skills




PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

• Experience with GPU, Nvidia DLA or other deep learning accelerators

• Master or PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering,

Computer Science and/or other related fields

• Experience with FPGA development flow, and familiar with Xilinx/Altera

FPGA internal hardware resources

• Hands-on programming and debugging experience in Verilog and

C/C++ 

• Familiar with basic deep learning concepts, including convolutional neural network and recurrent neural network

• Experience with at least one major machine learning framework, such as Tensorflow and PyTorch

• Basic understanding of computer architecture (e.g., memory, caching, DMA) and computing platforms (e.g., CPU, GPU, FPGA or DSP)

• Experience with performance profiling tools

Kuaishou is a short video social platform for all users to record and share their lives, with the core mission to "Capture the World, Share Your Story" to increase every individual's happiness through Big Data and AI technology.

About the group:

Media Algorithm Group (MAG)

The media lives everywhere in our life, which includes audio, image, video, text, and etc. Media algorithms play crucial roles from content creating to consuming in Kuaishou’s ecosystem. The Media Algorithm Group (MAG) is responsible for researching and developing innovative and optimized solutions for Kuaishou’s advanced media algorithms on different platforms to encourage a great user experience, maintaining the lowest cost, while using technology to inspire users to create more contents. The MAG’s focus areas include machine learning, content analysis, image/video processing, image/video compression and mobile/server system optimization.

 

Job Responsibilities:

•   Explore and develop innovative image/video analysis and processing algorithms.

•   Collaborate with other researchers and engineers on product integration.




Qualifications:

•   Graduate student actively pursuing MSc or PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related majors.

•   Familiar with deep learning, computer vision, and/or image/video processing algorithms.

•   Good communication skills and team work.

• Recent publication in ICML, NIPS, SIGGRAPH, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, or other top-tier venues.

IDEMIA seeks a Customer Solution Architect (CSA) Intern who can work with our sales staff, business development team, marketing group, and clients to shape, and deliver technical solutions that meet our client's business requirements and efficiency objectives.

The CSA is a solution creator, working with our sales team as a Pre-Sales Engineer, providing technical sales support expertise for pursuits representing technology practitioners for the corporation. The CSA is responsible for assisting in assessing proposal and contract documents along with customer expectations across the modernized secure credentialing and vehicle oriented product suites and articulating those as formal requirements. The CSA assists in designing total customer solutions using primarily standard products with some custom software components. Working with the Systems Engineering and Development Engineering teams, the CSA applies their personal expertise in IT systems, data center operations, workflow design and systems integration to design effective customer solutions, custom demos, and customer facing documentation relating to solution architecture. The CSA attends customer meetings with Sales and Program Management and provides a technical point of contact for customers. This role will maintain a working knowledge of the capabilities and configuration options of the IDEMIA solutions.

We are looking for an intern who wants to devlop and mature these skiils

The ideal CSA candidate will be student pursuing a degree in CS, MIS or Sales Engineering. USA domestic travel may be required.

The skill you will learn are part of the Internship are

Identifying client business needs, and translating them into solutions
Assist in developing business opportunities, including meeting with clients, understanding the client's compelling events and business needs, interactively developing a solution with clients and IDEMIA engineering resources, responding to RFIs and RFPs, writing and presenting proposals, spearheading, customizing, and presenting end-user demos, and assisting with creating statements of work.
Assemble relevant resources and appropriate materials to support sales pursuits including acting as a liaison between the Sales Team and the Engineering Leads. Requires good analytic skills to probe and understand the client's situation, and then translate that knowledge into a solution specific to that client.
Working indirectly with customers to collect, synthesize and clearly communicate requirements primarily through written proposal responses
Technical: Assisting key projects in areas relating technology selection, architecture, and solution implementation.
Technical: Supporting the development and delivery of customized demos using software engineering best practices
Business: Acquiring knowledge in many business development activities including sales calls, client presentations, demonstrations, and proposal responses to RFI/RFPs.
Leverage: Supporting proposal efforts and strategies to win business in strategic markets or current accounts.



Note: In addition to the Essential Functions, also perform similar work-related duties as assigned.

Required Skills

Proficiency in standard office productivity tools such as Word, Excel, Powerpoint Etc
Familiarity with current technical tools and trends.



Required Experience

Strong oral and superior written communication skills
Ability to deal with and resolve ambiguity
Ability to anticipate problems and take decisive action
Ability to be a high-impact player on multiple simultaneous engagements



Qualifications, Education And Experience

Actively persuing a degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Technical Sales or related fields.



Travel Requirement, Working Conditions And Physical Demands

Travel Requirement: Occasional overnight US Domestic travel required, less than 10%.
Working Conditions: General office environment. The work area is adequately lighted, heated, and ventilated.
Physical Demands: Office environment where the employee may sit comfortably to do the work. Some walking, standing, bending, reaching, and carrying of light items such as papers, books, small parts; driving an automobile, etc. Requires eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate a keyboard, photocopier, telephone, and other office equipment.

Must be able to receive and analyze information
Must be able to quickly communicate solutions if problems occur
Must be able to demonstrate a high degree of sound judgement

Company Benefits

Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability & Life Insurance
401k
Paid holidays & vacation days

This job description is subject to change at any time.
Launch your career with a national building materials distributor and discover opportunities for growth and advancement. Our people have the independence and authority to make a difference. We invest in relationships, and every person is important. Our highest priority is serving others. We passionately pursue a safe work environment along with a relentless focus on operational excellence. We believe you can never go wrong doing the right thing.
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

An internship with Redcard provides students a great opportunity for hands on real world experience. We are large enough to provide a variety of opportunities but small enough to tailor your internship experience to meet your learning objectives and professional goals.
We have opportunities for students in a variety of different majors (Computer Science, Business, Human Resources, Management Information Systems etc).
Please submit your resume for review and answer a few specific questions attached to this application and then we will be in touch.

Job Summary

Headquartered in Houston, Texas, CITGO Petroleum Corporation is a recognized leader in the refining industry with a well-known brand. CITGO operates three refineries located in Corpus Christi, Texas; Lake Charles, La.; and Lemont, Ill., and wholly and/or jointly owns 45 terminals, nine pipelines and three lubricants blending and packaging plants. With approximately 3,500 employees and a combined crude capacity of approximately 749,000 barrels-per-day (bpd), CITGO is ranked as the fifth-largest, and one of the most complex independent refiners in the United States. CITGO transports and markets transportation fuels, lubricants, petrochemicals and other industrial products and supplies a network of approximately 4,900 locally owned and operated branded retail outlets in 30 states and the District of Columbia. CITGO Petroleum Corporation is owned by CITGO Holding, Inc. For more information, visit www.CITGO.com .

Job Summary

The Information Technology Co-op/Intern will be introduced to the Refinery and the Information Technology Department. They will become familiar with IT policies, processes, and procedures, and will provide assistance to technical projects and services throughout their assignment. Target work hours:

Part-time (up to 20 hours/week) for Spring 2020; Full-time (up to 40 hours/week) for Summer and Fall 2020


Job Responsibilities

Performs and assists with hardware/software evaluations and implementations
Hardware / Software troubleshooting and user support
Workstation lease replacements
Testing and execution of a Windows 10/Office 2016 upgrade
Custom application and database development, maintenance and support
SharePoint team site development, support and security analysis
Additional projects may be assigned, with regular status reports required. End of term presentation expected.


Education Required

Minimum Qualifications

Currently enrolled in an accredited degree program pursuing a bachelor's degree in Computer Science or closely related field
Overall GPA of 3.0 or above (A=4.0) (Must provide proof of current GPA at time of hire to verify education requirements are met)
Must have completed at least 60 credit hours (JR or SR classification)
Demonstrate successful completion of several programming classes


Preferred Skills Include

Windows 10
MS Office
SharePoint
InfoPath
.Net Development
Modern Web Development (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript/TypeScript, Angular/React)


Eligibility Requirements

Valid Driver's License

The Maritime Transportation Security Act requires all persons who will need unescorted access to a regulated facility to have a valid Transportation Worker Identification Credential (TWIC), issued in accordance with the rules established by the United States Coast Guard and the Transportation Security Administration. Candidates selected for employment must meet eligibility criteria to obtain a TWIC card.

To obtain more information on the Transportation Worker Identification Credential (TWIC), please visit the Transportation Security Administration’s website https://www.tsa.gov/for-industry/twic .

CITGO’s Attractive Benefits


Sliding salary scale based on classification

Relocation assistance available
401(k) Retirement and Savings Plan
Flexible work schedule (9-80)
Flexible co-op terms are available; however, alternating co-op semesters are not guaranteed and are conditional upon individual performance and position availability within the hiring department


(Equal Opportunity Employer)

SDL2019-2048

position: Special Worker / Student Worker - Mosquito Control
description:
Major Functions

The County of Volusia is seeking Student Workers for the Mosquito Control Division. This position is located in New Smyrna Beach, Florida and will be primarily be responsible for supporting mosquito and arbovirus surveillance operations. This positions will also be involved in the various daily operations of our Integrated Pest Management Program including but not limited to: collection and identification of mosquito species, data input and management, field inspections for mosquito production sites, public education and outreach, and insecticide resistance monitoring.

NOTE: Internship opportunity is also available for college credit if requirements are met.

Internship Opportunity Information

Illustrative Duties

Set and collect various types of mosquito traps on a routine basis throughout Volusia County.
Responsible for independently loading and unloading trap supplies, charging batteries and reporting damaged or nonfunctional supplies.
Responsible for driving and maintaining a shared county vehicle.
Use of microscopes to identify adult and larval mosquitoes.
Rear and maintain mosquito colonies in our insectary for resistance monitoring, efficacy trials and other special projects.
Input and manage mosquito collection data electronically; data analysis as required.
Use of internal programs to perform basic GIS related functions.
Participate in special projects such as insecticide efficacy trials in both lab and field settings.
Perform field inspections for mosquito production, including home inspections, for surveying both natural and man-made larval sites.
Interact positively with the public during operations.
Work with staff to amend or create educational materials, enhance website content and utility.
Maintain sentinel chicken flock and chicken coops.
May be assigned to other county locations based upon operational duties.
Attends work on a regular and consistent basis.
Must adhere to Federal, State, County and Local ordinances.
Responds to emergency situations.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Minimum Requirements

Salary for this position is as follows:

Undergraduate Salary: $10.00/hr.

Graduate Salary: $13.00/hr.

Must be an active Undergraduate or Graduate student, attending an accredited College/University OR attending vocational school.

Note: College/University student must be currently enrolled full-time (Spring/Fall semester – minimum 12 credit hours or Summer semester - minimum 6 credit hours), OR full-time Graduate Student (9 credit hours), OR a full-time student in an associate degree or vocational program.

Must possess and maintain a valid Florida driver's license.

Having met the minimum requirements, the preferred candidate will be currently seeking a degree in Biology, Entomology, Environmental Science or natural science or related field, Communications, Computer Science/Mathematics, Cartography, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), or Geospatial Analysis related field.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Ability to complete assignment within the project time period.
Ability to utilize a laptop, GPS, and/or comparable device.
Abilityto work under stressful conditions.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to learn the operation of four-wheel drive vehicles.
Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
Ability to interact effectively with others including the public.
Must be able to relocate to other county locations based upon operational needs.

Ada Requirements

Physical Demands: Medium work. Ability to traverse undeveloped, uneven, wet, broken terrain, wooded, marshy areas. Ability to see (peripheral vision, depth perception, acuity), talk, hear, reach, walk, bend, squat, kneel, grasp. Ability to lift, carry 35 lbs.

Environmental Demands: Inside and outside work. Ability to tolerate inclement weather including rain, humidity, heat, cold, and lightning. Potential exposure to saltwater, chemicals, insects, toxic plants, snakes, salt air, mud, dust, confined spaces and poor ventilation.

Mental Demands: Ability to read and comprehend technical and scientific reports and manuals; instructions, procedures, memos, letters. Ability to perform shop math. Ability to speak clearly and concisely to public and laymen; conversant in theory and practices of discipline. Ability to write reports, summaries, instructions, procedures, memos, letters.

Volusia County is a drug free workplace and an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce.

SDL2019-32

Job Summary

Pearl Insurance is currently seeking a part-time, Helpdesk Technician Intern. This is a great opportunity for college students and recent graduates. The position offers 25 to 29 hours per week with flexible scheduling. It also has the potential to transition into a full-time, regular position in the future.
The Helpdesk Technician Intern is responsible for providing technical assistance and support related to computer systems, hardware, and/or software to internal users. Responds to service/incident requests, performs routine operational activities, runs diagnostic programs, isolates problems, and determines and implements solutions.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Log and respond to incoming IT service desk calls and service requests/tickets and provide desktop and application support to troubleshoot internal user problems. Diagnose, research and resolve problems within scope of ability; forward more complex problems to upper level support providers. Provide ongoing communication to end users regarding issue status.
Review incoming electronic service requests for completeness and assign appropriate priority.
Handle customer incidents, requests, and complaints with a positive and diplomatic attitude.
Execute and monitor batch jobs in accordance with operational schedule or as required. Run scheduled audit processes, database updates and maintenance programs. Maintain documentation for each process or batch.
Maintain Pearl Companies asset management process.
Maintain Pearl Companies backup tape management process.
Present a professional image of Pearl Companies at all times. Maintain professional appearance and conduct.
Maintain and update technical knowledge, skills, and certifications through on-the-job training, reading, seminars, classes, web research, and other educational resources

Qualifications

Associate's degree in computer science or related field or currently working towards obtaining a degree; 1+ years of IT system maintenance experience with an emphasis in network and desktop support; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Strong interpersonal skills with a proven ability to interface with both technical and business team members at all levels within an organization.

position: Cyber Security Software Development Engineer Co-Op, Advanced Cyber Science - Spring 2021
description:
Job Description

Do you have a passion for innovation?

So do we! At CACI our people are our greatest asset – we make sure your voice is heard and give you the resources to invent solutions to some of the most difficult challenges facing our customers. Our entrepreneurial environment fosters your best ideas and allows you to build your career to fit your creativity. Sound interesting? We’re always looking for the best and brightest to join our ranks and share the fun.

What We Are Looking For

We are seeking talented, creative and highly motivated undergraduate (Juniors & Seniors) and/or Graduate students for Co-Op/Internship and rising Computer Science and Computer/Electrical Engineers to work at our research and technology Labs in one of the following locations: Florham Park, NJ . We are seeking the ‘Best and Brightest’ with a "PASSION" to solve tough challenges through innovation and the application of Science and Technology.

What You’ll Get To Do

The Cyber Department performs basic and Applied Research and Prototype Development in various aspects of Cyber and general Network Security. The ideal candidate for this role will perform research, prototype development, software engineering and integrated systems development in various aspects of cyber, analytics, machine learning, optimization, computer networking and general network security.

You’ll Bring These Qualifications

Upper Classman leading to BS, or graduate studies leading to MS or Ph. D. in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering
Research solutions to challenging Cyber, analytics, Machine Learning, optimization and computer networking problems
Design, implement and test research prototype software
Integrate software into larger system, design test cases and evaluate solution effectiveness
Contribute to high performance technical teams to innovate and execute both short-term and long-term project goals
Contribute to briefing project results and demo software and/or hardware to technical and non-technical audiences
Travel to other CACI/LGS Locations or Customer Sites as necessary
Understand and adhere to all CACI/LGS Ethical and Compliance policies
Proactively ensure a safe work environment and adhere to CACI/LGS EH&S policies and procedures
Ability to obtain/maintain government security clearance at the level required to perform the duties of the position
Willingness to learn new skills and eagerness to investigate new problems both independently and as part of a small team
Broad computer science, analytics, machine learning, optimization and/or networking background, which may include knowledge in cybersecurity, IP networking, and software development
Strong analytical skills with the ability to independently solve problems
Software development and software engineering life cycle experience in current languages and best practices
Working knowledge of IP (v4 and v6) and computer and network security
Perform other duties as required
Ability to clearly communicate technical ideas


These Qualifications Would Be Nice To Have

Network security, especially security of the public Internet
Security strengths and weaknesses of protocols at the network, transport, and application layers
Intrusion detection systems, information security systems, firewalls, antivirus systems, and honeypots
Fingerprinting, scanning, and hacking techniques
Machine learning and data analytics
Optimization, cryptography and other advanced algorithms
Experience with distributed computing and mobile ad hoc networking protocols and implementations


Working Conditions

Work is typically performed in an office environment which requires proper safety precautions
Work requires some physical effort in the handling of materials, boxes, or equipment
The above job description is not intended to be, nor should it be construed as, exhaustive of all responsibilities, skills, efforts, or working conditions associated with the job
Requests for reasonable accommodations will be considered to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position


What We Can Offer You

We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post
Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives
We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities
We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities
For over 55 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success
LGS Innovations and its subsidiaries are wholly-owned subsidiaries of CACI International, Inc.


LGSACS

inrn2

Job Location

US-Florham Park-NJ-NEW JERSEY METRO

CACI employs a diverse range of talent to create an environment that fuels innovation and fosters continuous improvement and success. At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is proud to provide dynamic careers for employees worldwide. CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

We are seeking talented, creative and highly motivated undergraduate (Juniors & Seniors) and/or Graduate students for Co-Op/Internship and rising Computer Science and Computer/Electrical Engineers to work at our research and technology Labs in one of the following locations: Florham Park, NJ . We are seeking the ‘Best and Brightest’ with a "PASSION" to solve tough challenges through innovation and the application of Science and Technology.

What You’ll Get To Do

The Cyber Department performs basic and Applied Research and Prototype Development in various aspects of Cyber and general Network Security. The ideal candidate for this role will perform research, prototype development, software engineering and integrated systems development in various aspects of cyber, analytics, machine learning, optimization, computer networking and general network security.

You’ll Bring These Qualifications

Upper Classman leading to BS, or graduate studies leading to MS or Ph. D. in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering
Research solutions to challenging Cyber, analytics, Machine Learning, optimization and computer networking problems
Design, implement and test research prototype software
Integrate software into larger system, design test cases and evaluate solution effectiveness
Contribute to high performance technical teams to innovate and execute both short-term and long-term project goals
Contribute to briefing project results and demo software and/or hardware to technical and non-technical audiences
Travel to other CACI/LGS Locations or Customer Sites as necessary
Understand and adhere to all CACI/LGS Ethical and Compliance policies
Proactively ensure a safe work environment and adhere to CACI/LGS EH&S policies and procedures
Ability to obtain/maintain government security clearance at the level required to perform the duties of the position
Willingness to learn new skills and eagerness to investigate new problems both independently and as part of a small team
Broad computer science, analytics, machine learning, optimization and/or networking background, which may include knowledge in cybersecurity, IP networking, and software development
Strong analytical skills with the ability to independently solve problems
Software development and software engineering life cycle experience in current languages and best practices
Working knowledge of IP (v4 and v6) and computer and network security
Perform other duties as required
Ability to clearly communicate technical ideas


These Qualifications Would Be Nice To Have

Network security, especially security of the public Internet
Security strengths and weaknesses of protocols at the network, transport, and application layers
Intrusion detection systems, information security systems, firewalls, antivirus systems, and honeypots
Fingerprinting, scanning, and hacking techniques
Machine learning and data analytics
Optimization, cryptography and other advanced algorithms
Experience with distributed computing and mobile ad hoc networking protocols and implementations


Working Conditions

Work is typically performed in an office environment which requires proper safety precautions
Work requires some physical effort in the handling of materials, boxes, or equipment
The above job description is not intended to be, nor should it be construed as, exhaustive of all responsibilities, skills, efforts, or working conditions associated with the job
Requests for reasonable accommodations will be considered to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position


What We Can Offer You

We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post
Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives
We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities
We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities
For over 55 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success
LGS Innovations and its subsidiaries are wholly-owned subsidiaries of CACI International, Inc.

Baidu Autonomous Driving Technology Department (ADT), located in Silicon Valley CA, is offering research internships in autonomous driving for summer 2020. Baidu ADT is aiming to develop advanced autonomous driving technologies that will let us transform mobility and improve the lives of billions of people. As a research intern, you will be uniquely positioned to access Baidu Apollo Platform, our internal datasets and computing clusters, design and build technologies to make autonomous driving a reality together with our engineers and researchers.

Here’s what you will do:

  Work with world-class talented group of software engineers and scientists to design, implement and integrate cutting edge autonomous driving technologies on Apollo platform
  Practice data-driven methodology in developing autonomous driving software and enjoy playing with data sets at large scale
  Utilize what you learn at college to build, testify and optimize the overall onboard computation system to meet real-time needs

Here’s what we’d like to see in you:

  Programming skills in C++.
  Strong understanding of algorithms and computer architecture
  Practical experience with Linux system
  Experience in real-time system design or communications protocol is preferred
  MS/Ph.D. student in Computer Science (or equivalent).
  Bilingual in Mandarin and English

Baidu Autonomous Driving Technology Department (ADT), located in Silicon Valley CA, is offering research internships in autonomous driving for summer 2020. Baidu ADT is aiming to develop advanced autonomous driving technologies that will let us transform mobility and improve the lives of billions of people. As a research intern, you will be uniquely positioned to access Baidu Apollo Platform, our internal datasets and computing clusters, design and build technologies to make autonomous driving a reality together with our engineers and researchers.

Here’s what you will do:

  Work with world-class talented group of software engineers and scientists to design and implement cutting edge autonomous driving technologies.
  Develop/Improve visual sensor calibration tools at scale, I.e (IMU/Lidar/Camera/Radar)
  Train machine learning and deep learning models on a computing cluster to perform visual recognition tasks.
  Enjoy access to large scale autonomous driving proprietary data, run experiments, learn, iterate, and ship

Here’s what we’d like to see in you:

  Programming skills in Python or C++.
  Strong understanding of computer vision and machine learning: you should be familiar with the process (data collection, training, evaluation, and making iterative improvements) of building effective learning systems.
  Experience with at least one main stream deep learning frameworks, includingPyTorch, TensorFlow, Caffe(2), MXNet, 
  Experience with GPU programming languages including CUDA or openCL.
  Experience with common sensor calibration algorithms for Lidar/Camera/Radar.
  Publication record in top venues (CVPR/ECCV/ICCV, etc) and experience in autonomous driving is a plus.
  Ph.D. student in Computer Science (or equivalent).
  Bilingual in Mandarin and English.

Baidu Research General AI team (GAIT) is looking for an outstanding research intern with strong background in computer vision, machine learning, deep learning. Our mission is to research and develop next generation artificial intelligence (AI) technologies for image and video understanding as well as related products in cloud, intelligent cameras and robots. As a research intern at Baidu, you will be uniquely positioned in our team to work on different industry problems and to push forward frontiers of AI technologies. Publications in premier conferences or journals are also highly encouraged.

Qualifications :

PhD Student in Computer Science, EE, Applied Mathematics, or related fields.
Publication record in premier AI-related venues such as CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, NIPS, PAMI, TIP or other related major conferences or journals.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Team player with good communication skills.
Strong coding skill with Python, CUDA, C/C++ and so on.

Preferred knowledge/skills:

Experience in neural architecture search
Experience in neural model compression
Experience in video understanding and so on

Description

Los Angeles-based Internet Brands is currently seeking a bright, motivated Technical Project Management Intern to support the development of various web based software projects. You will work with a team of talented engineers and web professionals who are passionate about the web and where it's going. This is a great opportunity for students or recent graduates to learn the ins and outs of building great web products in a fast-paced, growing company.

The ideal candidate will either have (or be working towards) a degree in computer science, experience building websites, and a solid understanding of how websites work.

Responsibilities

Help to manage software project elements from conception through launch.
Participate in iteration planning.
Help with requirements gathering.
Coordinate with other site teams on projects.
Ensure there’s a strong pipeline of work for the engineers.
Help break down business requirements into tangible work for the engineers.
Ensure projects are implemented according to requirements.
Keep the team and other constituents up to date on project status and potential issues.
Ensure projects are launched according to published schedules.
Help to resolve project, design, or resource issues before they cause schedule delays.

Qualifications

Passion for the web, social media, mobile, etc.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and follow-through.
Must enjoy solving problems using analytical and creative skills.
Able to plan work, organize time, and maintain workflow.
Able to interact professionally with all levels of staff.
Involved with delivering a technical project a plus.
HTML, CSS, Adobe creative suite a plus.
Programming experience a plus.

About Internet Brands

Headquartered in El Segundo, Calif., Internet Brands® is a fully integrated online media and software services organization focused on four high-value vertical categories: Health, Automotive, Legal, and Home/Travel. The company's award-winning consumer websites lead their categories and serve more than 250 million monthly visitors, while a full range of web presence offerings has established deep, long-term relationships with SMB and enterprise clients. Internet Brands' powerful, proprietary operating platform provides the flexibility and scalability to fuel the company's continued growth. Internet Brands is a portfolio company of KKR and Temasek. For more information, please visit www.internetbrands.com.

Internet Brands and its wholly owned affiliates are an equal opportunity employer.

At Jostens, we help people capture, celebrate and inspire through their stories and accomplishments with uniquely customized and personalized products for students and families, educators and schools, teams, and world class athletes and their fans.
Jostens is excited to offer a paid internship position in our Finance department.

Data Scientist Intern

This position will support the Jostens' Finance & Marketing Team by working on a variety of tasks and projects including:

Statistical Modeling & Analysis
Predictive Analytics
Visualization of Data
Translation of Technical Content into Strategy
Various Project Support

What We're Seeking

A recent college graduate with an Computer Science, Applied Statistics, Machine Learning, or Mathematics degree
Excellent analytical and computer skills, with emphasis in big data principles and technology
Good communication and organization skills
Strong desire to learn and add value

Internship Start Date: September 2020
Internship End Date: 3 mos with possibility of full-time employment offer
Hours per week: Up to 40

About Jostens

Celebrating over 120 years of business, Jostens has been a part of local communities, working with K-12 schools, colleges and universities, teams and affiliation groups. Representatives from Jostens touch thousands of schools and groups every day, working to make a difference with products and services that recognize accomplishments and help people tell their stories. These products, along with resources for educators, yearbook curriculum and services to help motivate and inspire like Jostens Renaissance® and Commitment to Graduate (C2G) are all designed to contribute to a positive and rewarding school experience. As a household name and leading brand in our market, we are passionate about being the most trusted partner in celebrating moments that matter. We are a mid-size company with a small company feel, allowing us to move fast and explore innovative ideas.
Jostens is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with applicable employment laws. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled are encouraged to apply.

The core function of the Web Developer Internship is to gain experience in web development and support the web development team. Interns will be responsible for delivering, maintaining and improving websites under the Liftable Media brands and for Liftable Media clients. We're looking for someone to be apart of a team that is developing responsive and engaging sites, with an eye towards site design, optimization and usability across multiple distribution channels (web, email, social) and multiple platforms (mobile, tablet, desktop). We want people that are passionate about what we stand for. The story, values, and mission of Liftable Media may be found on our about page.

This is a full-time or part-time paid internship with a Monday - Friday work schedule.

Responsibilities

Assist with one or more of the following:

Front-end web development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
Back-end web development (WordPress, PHP, MySQL)
System administration (Linux, NGINX)


Qualifications

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or earning a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field
Must have good communication skills, be highly motivated and able to work independently
Able to read, understand and debug existing code
Be a continuous learner and desire to help others learn
Desired:

1+ years of foundational knowledge and hands-on experience with Web Applications and various programming languages such as HTML/CSS/JavaScript
1+ years of team development environment experience


Company Perks

We value company culture and hold it to a high standard. For this reason, we try to make work a fun, relaxed, and highly productive environment. Therefore, we offer the following benefits:

Modern 30,000 sq. ft. building with an employee lounge, game room, library, and gym
Casual work environment
Walking distance to Anthem businesses and restaurants
Monthly catered lunch for the office

We are looking for a highly motivated advanced analytics intern to drive insight for key business stakeholders, across our internal functional areas. This role will be integral in building our advanced analytics toolset. Working in tandem with our BI Analysts & Operations teams, this position will work to build scalable tooling that provides proactive impact analysis and adds automation to our advanced analytic stack.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter with a strong interest in business and an affinity for how organizational goals and data come together to support a growing company. Bring your data science skills and come help us solve some of our most challenging and important business problems.

Essential Responsibilities

Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business decisions & business process optimization.
Act as a key contributor in providing advanced analytics (predictive and prescriptive) and recommendations to our business stakeholders, with a core focus on improving our ability to systematically determine key drivers of a complex business.
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, marketing spend and other business outcomes.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.
Provide clear visualizations and present analyses to management and executive-level stakeholders, using Business Intelligence tools and predictive analytics to drive key decisions
Provide recommendations to Business Intelligence leadership on best practices and the continual improvement in advanced analytics at Rapid7

Job Requirements

Bachelor's or Master's degree candidate in Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science or related technical field (min. GPA of 3.0) with prior technical internship or data science experience.
Experience using R, Python, and SQL to manipulate data and draw insights from large, diverse data sets.
Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
Experience visualizing/presenting data using: matplotlib, ggplot, rShiny, Tableau, etc.
Must be a fast learner with high attention to detail and possess a passion for data, data quality & business analytics
Must have excellent communication & interpersonal skills, utilizing data to tell a story
Self-motivated and accountable; able to take direction and manage prioritization of work
Results-oriented and collaborative; able to work independently as well as part of a team
